means: [有时作D-][宗教]（世界末日来临时的）最后审判日
会导致广泛（或全面） 毁灭的

sentence.Network_en: This work will take me till doomsday.
sentence.Network_cn: 这工作要花我一辈子的时间.

sentence.Network_en: We're going to build the Doomsday Machine and conquer the world.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们将建起世界末日时光机来征服整个世界.

sentence.Network_en: If they stop , the blimps switch to a doomsday program.
sentence.Network_cn: 使得飞行船上的程式启动那该怎么办?

lj.lj_ly: we'll be here till doomsday if you go blethering on.
lj.lj_ls: 如果你继续胡说，我们就要永远呆在这儿了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English dōmes dæg (see doom, day)

entry.def: Doomsday is a day or time when you expect something terrible or unpleasant is going to happen.

example.ex: ...the doomsday scenario of civil war between the two factions.
example.tran: 两个派系之间的内战可能会带来世界末日般的灾难

entry.tran: (基督教) 世界末日，最后审判日
entry.def: In the Christian religion, Doomsday is the last day of the world, on which God will judge everyone.

means.word_mean: 1. (New Testament) day of the Last Judgment when God will decree the fates of all men according to the good and evil of their earthly lives

sentences.sentence: "everyone was aware of the approaching doom but was helpless to avoid it"
"that's unfortunate but it isn't the end of the world"
